creator: palfreman
title: how to create a low budget movie
materials_required: Camera dolly (homemade options include wheelchair or skateboard)
Materials for homemade fake blood (red food coloring, thick syrup, green food dye, latex gloves)
Balloons, tube, and elastic bands (for zombie effects)
Liquid latex (for fake limb and zombie effects)
description: This Instructable guides you through the process of creating a low-budget movie, covering pre-production planning, gear selection, location scouting, costume and prop considerations, makeup techniques, filming tips, actor direction, special effects, editing, and general advice.
steps: Think of a plot, consider the necessary elements for your chosen genre, select actors, and determine locations. Plan the storyline and script, outlining camera angles, actor actions, and editing notes.
Gather necessary gear, considering budget options for camera dollies, tripods, green screens, lighting, and editing software. Explore homemade alternatives where possible.
Scout and select locations, considering their suitability for the movie's theme and the availability of different shot opportunities. Utilize homes, gardens, parks, or other accessible areas.
Plan costumes and props based on the movie's theme. Create, rent, or purchase realistic costumes and gather relevant props like weapons or tools.
Use makeup instead of masks. Experiment with eyeshadow, lip gloss, and other readily available makeup to make people look pretty, wounded, etc.
Film action shots with quick camera position changes. Before filming, explore different angles to achieve the best shot. Move, then freeze, and start filming again to create the sense of speed.
Ensure actors stay in character and fit their roles. Take some time to find the right actors to avoid having to reshoot.
Utilize a green screen (or green tablecloth) for special effects like multiplying actors or creating fantastical backgrounds. Use free or affordable software for chroma key effects.

Create non-computer effects like fake blood pouches (using food coloring and syrup), moving zombie parts (using balloons and tubes), fake limbs (using stuffed clothing and polystyrene), and pulling a heart out (using a fake body and potato).
Edit the movie using editing software to assemble scenes, add special effects, and incorporate transitions. Explore various editing techniques to enhance the visual impact.

Be careful when creating a comedy and that all find it funny not just you. Dont steal other peoples ideas. Use your imagination. You can create a cheap liquid latex by adding water to jelotine. Dont make the movie to impress, make shore you enjoy yourself whilst making the movie.
